p: The chemical analysis showed that both essential oils are characterized by the presence of high amounts of monoterpene hydrocarbons (94.4–96.6%), mainly α-pinene (29.0–36.0%), β-pinene (26.1–30.7%) and limonene (10.5–13.5%). The essential oil from Coimbra region represents a much larger population and, therefore, was selected to assess the antifungal and anti-inflammatory potential of the oil.
